resource_desc_short: This resource defines the role of a Lead Advocate, and details how a Church Advocate Clinic equips a Lead Advocate to serve.
resource_desc_long: Good leadership is essential in building a sustainable ministry, and understanding the role of a Lead Advocate is key to finding the right leaders. This resource defines the role of a Lead Advocate, and details how a Church Advocate Clinic equips a Lead Advocate to serve.

resource_desc_short: This resource provides a list of roles and guidance for how ministry responsibilities may be divided and distributed.
resource_desc_long: This resource provides a list of roles and guidance for how ministry responsibilities may be divided and distributed.

resource_desc_short: This resource will guide you in who is needed, what to do when sharing the need for Advocate team volunteers, and what Advocate team volunteers can contribute.

resource_desc_short: Ask God what your ministry should look like and where to focus your efforts, and then complete this Ministry Action Plan (MAP) as you to help make this vision a reality and to develop a strong FAM.
resource_desc_long: What is the vision for the FAM at your church? We invite you to ask God what the ministry should look like, and where to focus your efforts. Then, complete this Ministry Action Plan (MAP) as you to help make this vision a reality and to develop a strong FAM.

resource_desc_long: Service projects are great ways to draw new interest in your ministry and give people a glimpse of how they can help. This resource provides a list of elements to include when planning a service project, as well as a list of suggested service projects.

resource_desc_short: This resource defines the steps to creating a strong volunteer base.
resource_desc_long: Recruiting volunteers occurs naturally through creating awareness and through the process of surrounding families with Care Communities. This resource defines the steps to creating a strong volunteer base.

resource_desc_short: This resource provides guidance on planning, preparing, hosting, and following up after a Care Community Volunteer Orientation.
resource_desc_long: Every volunteer must complete the Care Community Volunteer Orientation, no matter their level of service. This resource provides guidance on planning, preparing, hosting, and following up after a Care Community Volunteer Orientation.
resource_keywords: Care Community, orientation, host, plan, event

resource_desc_short: Utilize this resource as a guide in the event that you face a situation with a volunteer that requires your redirection, counsel, and wisdom.
resource_desc_long: Once volunteers are engaged in serving families, you may run into the occasional issue with someone not performing the required tasks. Utilize this resource as a guide in the event that you face a situation with a volunteer that requires your redirection, counsel, and wisdom.

resource_desc_short: This overview outlines the steps to forming a Care Community and tips to help the process run smoothly.
resource_desc_long: Establishing and maintaining Care Communities will likely be the central focus of your work. This overview outlines the steps to forming a Care Community and tips to help the process run smoothly.

resource_name: Pertinent Information for Care Community Formation
resource_desc_short: This resource provides tips for launching Care Communities and methods of recruiting volunteers.
resource_desc_long: The goals of Care Community formation are to support the independence and ownership of the Care Community by its volunteers, and to launch a Care Community before a family in the process of becoming licensed receives their first placement. This resource provides tips for launching Care Communities and methods of recruiting volunteers.

resource_desc_short: Use this resource as a topical guide to explain and answer questions that arise.
resource_desc_long: Building relationships between supported families and their Care Communities is key to the success of working together, and a phone call or in-person conversation is best practice due to the personal nature of the information to be relayed. Use this resource as a topical guide to explain and answer questions that arise.

resource_name: Launching a Care Community for Adoptive Families
resource_desc_short: This resource offers best practices on launching Care Communities for adoptive families.
resource_desc_long: All types of adoptive families face similar adjustments and struggles much like foster families, and as long as the adoptive family desires to be supported, the support of a Care Community is very appropriate. This resource offers best practices on launching Care Communities for adoptive families.

resource_desc_short: Use this resource to guide you through preparing and hosting a Care Community launch.
resource_desc_long: Ready to host a Care Community Launch? Use this resource to guide you through preparing and hosting the event. The checklist and information forms included will help you stay organized and on track for a successful launch!
resource_keywords: checklist, event, sign-up, mentor, leader, helper

resource_desc_short: Follow this guide when planning and preparing to relaunch a Care Community.
resource_desc_long: Need to relaunch a Care Community for a supported family? If a year has passed, the Care Community has changed significantly, or the needs of the family have changed, it may be time for a Re-Launch. Follow this guide when planning and preparing for a Re-Launch.

resource_name: Care Community Team Leader Training: Overview
resource_desc_short: This resource gives an overview of Team Leader training, including how to prepare and complete the training, and how to support the Team Leader throughout the process and after the training is completed.
resource_desc_long: Effectively training the Team Leader is the key to creating independent Care Communities that will require minimal attention from you. This resource gives an overview of Team Leader training, including how to prepare and complete the training, and how to support the Team Leader throughout the process and after the training is completed.

resource_name: Care Community Team Leader Training: 10 Simple Steps
resource_desc_short: This resource is a step-by-step guide to lead you through the Team Leader Training process.
resource_desc_long: This resource is a step-by-step guide to lead you through the Team Leader Training process.

resource_desc_short: This resource is a helpful tool that provides good questions to ask your Team Leaders during your regular checkpoints.
resource_desc_long: Team Leaders need you to walk beside them, encourage them, and praise their important work. Everyone needs to know that they matter and that someone recognizes their efforts. This resource is a helpful tool that provides good questions to ask your Team Leaders during your regular checkpoints.

resource_desc_short: Although each state varies in the timing and specific requirements, this document contains a comprehensive list of commonly found elements required to vet foster families.
resource_desc_long: As an Advocate, it is important that you are familiar with the foster family certification process required in your state. Although each state varies in the timing and specific requirements, this document contains a comprehensive list of commonly found elements required to vet foster families.

resource_name: Working with Child Welfare Agencies and Child Placing Agencies: Overview
resource_desc_short: This resource offers guidance on working with agencies because we believe that working closely with child welfare agencies can bring healing and grace to a broken system.
resource_desc_long: Our desire is for our church partners to work as closely as possible with their local, county, and state child welfare agencies, including private agencies where applicable. This resource offers guidance on working with agencies because we believe that working closely with child welfare agencies can bring healing and grace to a broken system.

resource_desc_short: This resource offers guidance on affirming foster families before and after the certification process is complete.
resource_desc_long: Churches affirm foster families by being loyal to them and committed in our support of them. This resource offers guidance on affirming foster families before and after the certification process is complete.

resource_desc_long: This resource provides an email template for reaching out, making an introduction, and offering a Care Community to a new foster family.

resource_desc_short: This resource provides an email template for offering a Care Community to an existing foster family.
resource_desc_long: This resource provides an email template for offering a Care Community to an existing foster family.

resource_name: Email - Potential Volunteers for a Foster Family in Your Church
resource_desc_short: This resource provides an email template to potential volunteers for a Care Community.
resource_desc_long: This resource provides an email template to potential volunteers for a Care Community. This email is a particularly good resource when contacting volunteers whose names were given by the supported family.

resource_name: Email - Care Community Launch for a Foster Family in Your Church
resource_desc_short: This resource provides an email template for a Care Community Launch for a foster family in your church.
resource_desc_long: This resource provides an email template for a Care Community Launch for a foster family in your church.

resource_name: Email - Potential Volunteers for a Foster Family Outside Your Church
resource_desc_short: This resource provides an email template for Care Community volunteers inviting them to serve a foster family outside of their church.
resource_desc_long: This resource provides an email template for Care Community volunteers inviting them to serve a foster family outside of their church.
resource_content:
Example 1 Subject: Possible Care Community 

Hello, 
Thank you for your patience while we have taken time to find a foster family for you to serve. A large family just about 10 minutes from your home is in need of a Care Community. They have 3 biological children ages 12-16 and two children in foster care ages 2 and 3. 

They need regular meals and some help with childcare for the young ones on the weekend, so they can go out on a much-needed date. They have been fostering for five years without any help and are really looking forward to being served by loving volunteers. Please let me know in the next three days (by Thursday) if you would like to serve this family. I will then be sending out a few options for our one-hour launch meeting where we will get to know each other better and plan how we can best serve this amazing family. 

Please prayerfully consider which role(s) you’d like to fulfill. You can do any combination of bringing a meal once a month to providing childcare to serving as the Team Leader. I look forward to launching this team and supporting this foster family.
Blessings,
Name/Title/Contact

Example 2 Subject: Possible Care Community Thank you for your willingness to serve a local agency family. We have found a family just an eight-minute drive from your home that is in need of support. This foster family has two young children in foster care in their care, ages 4 and 5. They are a young couple and have no children of their own yet. They are delighted to have a team of people praying for them and bringing meals. They are looking forward to having some regular childcare and would love help every other Sunday evening when they have to attend their small group Bible study. Please let me know in the next three days (by Friday) whether you’d like to join this team. Please be prayerfully considering if you’d like to help bring a monthly meal, provide childcare, serve as Team Leader, or any combination of these roles. We will be starting this Care Community soon. Once I hear from all potential volunteers, I will be sending several options for dates and times to schedule the one-hour launch. I look forward to hearing from you this week. What a blessing and encouragement this will be for this young family! Thank you for your heart for vulnerable children. Blessings,
Name/Title/Contact

resource_desc_long: We recommend praying individually for the ministry and also gathering regularly as an Advocate Team to pray, dedicating a certain amount of time each meeting for prayer. This resource offers encouragement as you spiritually prepare for ministry.

resource_desc_long: Setting goals is an essential part of starting and growing your FAM. This resource will help you begin to think through the direction of your ministry so you can work toward beginning your ministry action plan.

resource_desc_long: Establishing a sustainable FAM takes dedicated prayer, much time, and hard work. This resource serves as a reminder that building this ministry is a marathon, not a sprint!

resource_name: Next Steps Following the Advocate Clinic
resource_desc_short: So you've been to a Clinic, but now what? Check out this resource for guidance on your next steps following an Advocate Clinic.
resource_desc_long: So you've been to a Clinic, but now what? Check out this resource for guidance on your next steps following an Advocate Clinic.
resource_content:
“Next Steps” Following the Advocate Clinic 
 
You have learned a great deal today at the Clinic! Much of this information will come to life once you actually start creating awareness and forming Care Communities. In order to launch a sustainable Family Advocacy Ministry in your church, here is our recommendation for next steps as you begin and continue the momentum gained from our time together at the Advocate Clinic. 
	 
Within the first week following the Advocate Clinic....

resource_name: Determining The Focus Of Your FAM
Creating Foster Care Awareness - Event Promotion
resource_desc_short: This resource offers ideas on what to share, and how to promote your event.
resource_desc_long: Once you have decided which Awareness Event you’ll host and have the necessary follow-up events scheduled, it’s time to spread the word to your congregation! This resource offers ideas on what to share, and how to promote your event.

resource_desc_long: Utilize this document when planning and preparing to host a FAM Awareness event, as it details the most important steps for a successful event.

resource_name: Foster Care: Common Abbreviations and Terms
resource_desc_short: This resource can help decode some of the commonly used abbreviations and terms in foster care.
resource_desc_long: Confused by the abundance of acronyms floating around? Never fear - this resource can help decode some of the commonly used abbreviations and terms in foster care.

resource_desc_short: An animated video that describes the opportunity churches and families have to help vulnerable children and help set them in homes that provide love and a forever family.
resource_desc_long: Explore the opportunity for churches and families to help vulnerable children as they travel the path of child welfare; ultimately setting them in homes that provide love and a forever family. Psalm 68:6 - "God sets the lonely in families."

resource_desc_short: An animated video that describes how churches and families can help support vulnerable children, living out the promise God makes in Psalm 68:6, which says, "God sets the lonely in families."
resource_desc_long: Did you know that children in foster care are at much higher risk for incarceration, sex trafficking, and unwed pregnancy. If just one family from each church in the U.S. welcomed a foster child, then every foster child in America would be able to receive the love, nurture, accountability, and hope they desperately need. Psalm 68:6 promises that “God sets the lonely in families,” and we want to put this promise into action. Created by Polymath Innovations for the Live The Promise.

resource_name: Care Communities: Why Support a Foster Family?
resource_desc_short: Join a Care Community at your church! Your support of a foster family enables them to foster stronger and longer.
resource_desc_long: Join a Care Community at your church! Your support of a foster family enables them to foster stronger and longer.

resource_name: A Promise Story: The Masters Family
resource_desc_short: The story of the Masters family is one of many playing out in foster homes supported by churches with a Family Advocacy Ministry (FAM).
resource_desc_long:
This Promise story depicts the importance of one family in the life of a child in foster care and the significance that a church can make in offering support to foster families. The story of the Masters family is one of many playing out in foster homes supported by churches with a Family Advocacy Ministry. 

Produced by Stuart Atkins (www.stuartatkinsfilms.com)

resource_desc_long: A handout that discusses the different roles in a Care Community, including family helper, child mentor, team leader, and interim caregiver.

resource_desc_long: This printable handout documents effective ideas for ways to positively connect with children in foster care when correction is necessary. resource_desc_short: Use this resource as a guide for planning and hosting a multi-Care Community Launch.
resource_desc_long: In your church, you may already have numerous families who need support immediately. It is possible to launch several (even up to five) Care Communities, at one time. This requires very good organization, communication, and planning. Use this resource as a guide for planning and hosting a multi-Care Community Launch.

resource_desc_short: This resource gives ideas and best practices for maintaining strong Care Communities.
resource_desc_long: Care Communities are meant to be a tight-knit group of people who are serving together in unity, even though they more often serve separately than they do together. How can we ensure these Care Community volunteers continue to feel like a team after the Launch and Meet & Greet? This resource gives ideas and best practices for maintaining strong Care Communities.

resource_desc_short: This video gives an overview of how Care Communities support families, sharing about the roles of family helpers, child mentors, and team leader.
resource_desc_long: This video gives an overview of how Care Communities support families, sharing about the roles of family helpers, child mentors, and team leader. It also explains how a Care Community works, and what is involved in getting started, from inviting others to serve in the Care Community, to identifying roles, and launching the team.

resource_desc_short: This document provides guidance on how to implement the reasonable and prudent parenting standards in Georgia, and unpacks the changes made to the policy in 2019.
resource_desc_long: This document provides guidance on how to implement the reasonable and prudent parenting standards in Georgia, and unpacks the changes made to the policy in 2019.

resource_name: GA DFCS Substitute Caregivers: Babysitting and Overnight Guidelines
resource_desc_short: This document contains the Georgia DFCS reasonable and prudent parenting guidelines for substitute caregivers in regards to babysitting and overnight.
resource_desc_long: This document contains the Georgia DFCS reasonable and prudent parenting guidelines for substitute caregivers in regards to babysitting and overnight.

resource_name: GA DFCS RPPS Routine Caregiver Guidelines and Forms
resource_desc_short: This document contains the RPPS guidelines, the caregiver child safety agreement, and routine substitute caregiver documentation.
resource_desc_long: This document contains the RPPS guidelines, the caregiver child safety agreement, and routine substitute caregiver documentation.

resource_desc_short: This resource offers guidance on RPPS, includes a caregiver child safety agreement, and routine substitute caregiver documentation and instructions. Other related forms are included, as well as RPPS FAQs.
resource_desc_long: The standard characterized by careful and sensible parental decisions that maintain children’s health, safety, well-being and best interests while at the same time encouraging their emotional and developmental growth. This resource offers guidance on RPPS, includes a caregiver child safety agreement, and routine substitute caregiver documentation and instructions. Other related forms are included, as well as RPPS FAQs.

resource_name: Foster Care - Common Abbreviations and Terms
resource_desc_short: Many of the abbreviations included in this list are commonly used in the world of foster care and it is important to become familiar with this terminology in order to better serve foster families and volunteers.
resource_desc_long: Many of the abbreviations included in this list are commonly used in the world of foster care and it is important to become familiar with this terminology in order to better serve foster families and volunteers.

resource_desc_short: In this resource, you will find ideas for support groups that are helpful to adoptive and fostering families - from organic groups that form over time to more structured and intentional groups.
resource_desc_long: In this resource, you will find ideas for support groups that are helpful to adoptive and fostering families - from organic groups that form over time to more structured and intentional groups.

resource_name: FAM FAQs: Bumps in the Road
resource_desc_short: This article addresses common frequently asked questions and possible solutions that may help when navigating these issues.
resource_desc_long: Once a FAM has been launched, challenges inevitably arise. This article addresses common frequently asked questions and possible solutions that may help when navigating these issues.

resource_desc_short: Use this resource as a guide on staying connected to the Promise686 team.
resource_desc_long: Please know that we want to help and advise you whenever you need it! We are here to coach, encourage, and support you. Use this resource as a guide on staying connected to the Promise686 team.

resource_desc_short: This resource highlights the features available in Promise Serves.
resource_desc_long: As your ministry grows you will quickly be unable to recall from memory who is serving whom, so good record keeping is essential! Promise Serves provides one place where all information about volunteers, foster and adoptive families, Care Communities, and events can be stored and recalled. This resource highlights the features available in Promise Serves.

resource_desc_short: This facilitator's guide details the necessary steps in preparing to host Adoption 101, including the timeline for preparation, promotion, facilitating the course, and follow-up.

resource_desc_short: This handout defines common adoption abbreviations and terms.
resource_desc_long: This handout defines common adoption abbreviations and terms.

resource_desc_short: This handout provides next steps for those considering adoption.
resource_desc_long: This handout provides next steps for those considering adoption. It includes questions for families to consider, as well as suggestions for conferences to attend.

resource_desc_short: Use this printable form to track the information and interests of your Adoption 101 attendees.
resource_desc_long: Use this printable form to track the information and interests of your Adoption 101 attendees.

resource_desc_short: This PowerPoint presentation guides Adoption 101 attendees through good next steps to take as a follow-up to Adoption 101.

resource_desc_short: This email template is a general response that can be used for following up with a family after attending Adoption 101.
resource_desc_long: This email template is a general response that can be used for following up with a family after attending Adoption 101. It points to the Exploring Adoption and Foster Care resource that families can use to learn more about fostering and adopting.

resource_desc_long: This email template is for following up with a family who expressed interest in applying for an adoption grant after attending Adoption 101. The email explains the two types of grants offered by Promise686 and details the process for applying.

resource_desc_short: This training video covers all of the topics related to managing events.
resource_desc_long:
About This Video 06/01/2019

This training video covers all of the topics related to managing events. This includes:

  • 00:55 - Event types
  • 01:24 - Contact Person
  • 03:14 - RSVP Options
  • 04:27 - Response card options
  • 06:34 - RSVP overview
  • 07:22 - Message RSVPs
  • 07:57 - Hosting event / response card
  • 11:39 - Managing responders
  • 12:44 - Manually entering volunteers

The link that you will use for your volunteers will use to respond at the event is: '.base_url().'

Important Your event will be available on the RSVP page immediately but it will not show up on the event list for the volunteers response until 1 hour before the event.

resource_name: How To: Refer Families for Support
resource_desc_short: This training video covers the end to end process for every step from family referral to an advocate claiming the family for support.
resource_desc_long:
About This Video 01/27/2020

This training video covers the end to end process for every step from family referral to an advocate claiming the family for support.

  • Refer Family Link
    [BASEURL]refer-familyy
    This link is to be used for people who want to refer a family for support (not the family themselves).
  • Request Care Community Support Link
    [BASEURL]request-care-community
    For privacy reasons, this link is to be used by the family only.

resource_name: Team Leader's Guide to Using the Calendar
resource_desc_short: This training video covers everything you need to know to get started using the calendar.
resource_desc_long:
This training video covers everything you need to know to get started using the calendar. This includes:

  • 00:07 - Getting started
  • 00:45 - Adding an event on the calendar
  • 01:49 - Viewing event details
  • 02:22 - Adding meals to the calendar
  • 04:08 - Reminders & confirming / declining meals
  • 04:36 - Give Volunteers Access
  • 04:51 - Volunteer view
  • 05:07 - Viewing meal responses

';

resource_name: How To: Use the FAM Resources
resource_desc_short: This training video covers everything you need to know to get started using the FAM Resources section of Promise Serves.
resource_desc_long:

  • 00:15 - Getting started
  • 00:21 - Tab based navigation
  • 00:35 - Viewing resource details
  • 00:50 - Video resources
  • 00:57 - Sharing resources
  • 01:18 - Special categories
  • 01:42 - Search feature

';

resource_name: What is a Care Community? (2 Minute Version)
resource_desc_short: This video gives an overview of how Care Communities support families, sharing about the roles of family helpers, child mentors, and team leader.
resource_desc_long: This video gives an overview of how Care Communities support families, sharing about the roles of family helpers, child mentors, and team leader. It also explains how a Care Community works, and what is involved in getting started, from inviting others to serve in the Care Community, to identifying roles, and launching the team.

resource_desc_short: "The Child Trends DataBank is an online resource for indicators of child and family well-being and associated measures. The DataBank includes close to 100 population-based measures, covering the domains of health and safety,
resource_desc_long: "The Child Trends DataBank is an online resource for indicators of child and family well-being and associated measures. The DataBank includes close to 100 population-based measures, covering the domains of health and safety, child care and education, and behaviors linked to positive and negative well-being."

resource_desc_short: Discipline practices for volunteers
resource_desc_long:
As a volunteer relating to children in foster care, you are responsible to adhere to the same 
disciplinary guidelines followed by foster parents. It is always a good idea to inquire of the 
foster parents which methods have been the most successful with the current child(ren) in their 
care. Below are effective ideas for ways to positively connect with children in foster care when 
correction is necessary. Please note these mandated disciplinary stipulations, as stated by  Child 
Welfare in the state of Wisconsin.
